titleStmt.title: J. W. Cardwell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4928

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Honorable Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky,

Your Petitioners citizens of Mercer County Kentucky most respectfully unite in the Petition of John D Hale that your Excellency will pardon him on the Indictment against him in the Mercer Circuit Court, on a charge of resecuing John Patterson-

J. W. Cardwell
Nat Gaither
M. Cummins J. P. MC
James D Hardin
Richard Board Clerk
Mercer Circuit Court
J C Vanarsdall Sheriff
Capt H. J. Burns
J Cozatt
Jas E Thompson
Preston Cloyd
O. Rednitz
J T. Vanarsdale
J. B. Thompson
W. A. Hoal
C. S. Abell Clerk
County court
C A Hardin
Thos Edwards P J M C C
A. D. Haynes J. P. M. C
S. E Brattin capcon
E. Low M.T.M.
F. Gabbert
M D Hall
D C May
Wm. W. Rupley
A. Devit. Charge Soldiers Home
M. V. Barnen J. M. C

Mercer Cir Ct
vs
John D Hale
Pardoned
21st June/64
